learning_outcomes.description: Research project - Demonstrate well-developed practical and theoretical research skills
Research project - Formulate hypotheses and test them with appropriate research
Research project - Keep detailed written records of all research activities
Research project - Present your findings as a research report in the format of a scientific manuscript
Research proposal - Summarise and critically appraise literature relevant to your field of study.
Research proposal - To identify goals and a explain strategies to achieve these.
Research proposal - To understand the methods to be employed in your research and their limitations.
Research proposal - To demonstrate the ability to consider time in project planning.
Seminars - Listen, read, analyse and critically evaluate scientific information presented in scientific seminars, and actively participate in seminar discussions
Seminars - Give clear, concise, organised and accurate oral presentations of your own research within the School and University
Seminars - Take successful diary notes during seminars to aid comprehension and recollection of scientific presentations, and to formulate questions for the speaker

assessments.due_date: Tuesday and Wednesday of Teaching Week 13 in the second semester of the Honours year.
assessments.task_description: Students will give a 10 minute verbal report of their research project, followed by 5 minutes for questions from the audience.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date: To be submitted by 2 pm on Friday in Teaching Week 13 in the second semester of the Honours year.
assessments.task_description: This is also referred to as a ‘thesis’. Your report should represent your own original work and clearly identify any research or analysis performed by someone else. The research report could be presented in the form of a scientific manuscript or a longer, ‘traditional’ thesis format. Please discuss the format of your thesis/report with your advisor. The length of a thesis may vary but could range between 4000 words to 8000 words. In exceptional circumstances it may exceed 8000 words – this must be discussed with your advisors and the Honours Coordinator, and will be dealt with on a case-by-case basis. Work counts will exclude abstract, figure and table captions, references, acknowledgement, or appendices. Refer to Honours Handbook for more information.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You are required to submit a Word version of your Research Report electronically via TurnItIn. The TurnItIn site can be accessed through the course Blackboard site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date: Tuesday and Wednesday of Teaching Week 13 in the second semester of the Honours year.
assessments.task_description: The purpose of the oral presentation is for students to have the opportunity to share their work in a public forum and feature the highlights of their project. It is important to emphasise that this oral presentation is not intended to be an inquisition; nor is it designed to put the candidate through a rigorous defence of the Thesis. Each student will have about 15 mins to deliver a presentation of their project and answer a few questions from the audience.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.topic:
Experimental study

Practical or theoretical experimental work, under the guidance of an experienced supervisor.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02
learning_activities.topic_description: Experimental study Practical or theoretical experimental work, under the guidance of an experienced supervisor.

learning_activities.topic:
Record Keeping

Recording the planning and outcome of experiments in a manner suitable for scientific research.


Learning outcomes: L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Record Keeping Recording the planning and outcome of experiments in a manner suitable for scientific research.
